{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with severe headache, which started after rugby practice and did not improve with her usual headache medication. She has a history of panic attacks and suicide attempts, suggesting a possible psychiatric component. However, the new onset of slurred speech and weakness on one side of the body raises concern for a neurological cause. Given the sudden onset and progression of symptoms, as well as the presence of risk factors such as recent rugby practice, a hemorrhagic stroke is the most likely cause. A head CT is ordered to confirm the diagnosis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
